data.question: What is the empirical formula of NOF-1?
data.answer: C6 H4 N6 O4 Zn

data.question: What method was used for the crystal structure determination of NOF-1, NOF-2, and NOF-3?
data.answer: Single-crystal X-ray diffraction

data.question: How was the NO flux controlled during the irradiation experiments?
data.answer: By varying the intensity of the light source

data.question: True or False: The presence of NOF-1 in the PDMS layer induced notable cytotoxicity in HEK293 cells.
data.answer: False

data.question: What was the main advantage of using a near-infrared two-photon laser for NOF-1 photoactivation?
data.answer: It reduced the risk of photodamaging the cells with harmful ultraviolet irradiation while effectively inducing NO release.

data.question: What was the observed effect of NO delivery on HEK293-TRPC5 cells?
data.answer: A rapid increase in the intracellular calcium ion concentration

data.question: True or False: The NO-releasing properties of NOF-1 and NOF-2 were probed using the NO-selective ozone-chemiluminescence technique.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the role of sodium formate in the synthesis of microcrystalline NOF-1 and NOF-2 powders?
data.answer: It induced faster nucleation by ligand deprotonation.

data.question: True or False: The NOF-1 and NOF-2 frameworks provided sufficient spatial segregation to prevent intermolecular ligand interactions.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the effect of embedding NOF-1 microcrystals in a PDMS layer on NO release kinetics?
data.answer: It moderately slowed the release kinetics, but the total quantity of NO released remained comparable.

data.question: True or False: The irradiation of [Zn(MeIm)2]n did not induce any increase in the intracellular DAF-FM fluorescence in surrounding cells.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the purpose of using Matrigel in cell culture on an NOF-1/PDMS substrate?
data.answer: To facilitate cell adhesion and growth

data.question: True or False: The NOF-1/PDMS substrates were sterilized using 70% ethanol before cell culture.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the observed effect of heating NOF powders up to 200°C?
data.answer: Lack of significant NO release, confirming the thermal stability of NOF powders

data.question: True or False: The NOF-1 and NOF-2 are isostructural to previously reported ZIF compounds.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the main advantage of organizing nitro-containing imidazolate ligands into crystalline frameworks?
data.answer: Increased photoreactivity and adjustable release using light irradiation

data.question: True or False: The NOF-1 framework demonstrated significant absorption tailing in the range of 400–500 nm.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the effect of the cobalt analogue of NOF-1 on NO release?
data.answer: It failed to release significant quantities of NO compared with NOF-1

data.question: True or False: The NOF-3 framework released a significantly reduced amount of NO compared to NOF-1 under similar illumination.
data.answer: True

data.question: What was the role of the PDMS layer in the NOF-1/PDMS substrate?
data.answer: To completely embed the crystals in a biocompatible matrix allowing cellular adhesion
